page.title: 08Stambourne Dog Club
page.content: The Stambourne Village Dog Club was started in 1981 by Mr. Roy Hunter, a former dog handler,inspector and Deputy instructor in the Metropolitan Police. Before he moved to this village he had run seven dog clubs in London.The Club started with one class of about 10 dogs and now has five classes and about 40 dogs attend. The dogs are taught basic obedience and later agility.Some go on to learn tracking.They do an eight week course. To begin the dogs are taught to sit,go down,stand,walk without pulling and to come when called. It is the owners who are really trained as they have to continue to train their dogs at home. They are provided with homework sheets to help them do this.The owners come from as far away as Haverhill,Earls Colne,Harlow,Harwich,Clacton and Colchester.
